DOC.brief_summary: This double-blinded , randomize , prospective placebo-controlled clinical trial conduct within Mayo Clinic Mayo Clinic Health System . The goal research study gather information determine whether Doxycycline effective treatment unacceptable bleeding associate etonogestrel subdermal implant ( ESI ) , compare placebo .
DOC.detailed_description: ESI long-acting reversible contraceptive . Though safety efficacy establish world wide , 1 % woman report use method . Its use limit bleed pattern change result request early removal , commonly within first 8 month use . Women age 18-51 year , choose ESI meet eligibility criterion , offer enrollment study time ESI insertion . Every effort make insert Implanon day consent unless medically contraindicate . Prospective diary complete start date ESI insertion . All participant contact study personnel 13 week enrollment query presence unacceptable bleeding . Bleeding concern objectively assess use modification Pictorial Blood Loss Assessment Chart ( PBLAC ) . Participants initiate contact bleed concern time 13 week post-ESI insertion offer treatment randomization time contact . The basis randomize treatment whether bleeding consider `` unacceptable '' participant . This inherently subjective , constitute basis removal request . Participants report unacceptable bleed 13 week post-ESI insertion , call bleeding concern anytime 13 week post-ESI insertion , randomize one two group , Doxycycline match placebo . Participants report unacceptable bleed continue complete diary may eligible randomized treatment unacceptable bleeding develops .
DOC.criteria: Premenopausal woman , age 1851 year Expressed desire complianceindependent contraception No current pregnancy anticipate desire childbearing within 3 year study enrollment Implanon insertion Agreement participate study related procedure evaluation document sign informed consent Current prior use Implanon Current longterm use Doxycycline indication Known structural uterine abnormality polyp , submucosal leiomyoma Prior permanent sterilization endometrial ablation Pregnancy desire childbearing within 3 year Contraindications intolerance etonogestrel Allergy intolerance Doxycycline Inability unwillingness complete study relate procedure evaluation
